tourBios.exmtStatus: Top 16, 1999 SENIOR PGA TOUR National Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.otherVics: 1970 Southwest Conference Championship 1995 Texas Mid-Amateur Championship.
tourBios.carHigh: 1998: Was the low qualifier at the regional qualifier at Marsh Creek in St. Augustine, but missed the 36-hole cut at the National Q-School with a score of nine-over 153.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A lifelong amateur who played in just one PGA TOUR event, the 1971 Houston Champions International...Made the cut in that event and finished 73rd ...Played collegiate golf at the University of Texas from 1966- 1970 along with Rik Massengale and Tom Kite, and won the Southwest Conference Championship in 1970 while serving as the captain of the squad...Semi-finalist in the U.S. Mid-Amateur Championship in 1987 and was among the final four in the U.S. Public Links Championship in 1993...Won the Dallas City Championship twice and was a three-time champion in the Dallas/Fort Worth event...Competed in a total of 17 USGA events overall...Leading money-winner on the Heartland Senior Tour in 1999 after winning three events on that circuit...Played on five teams in the Texas Cup and was on 10 Mid-South Cup squads...Has had one hole-in-one in competition.
tourBios.personal: Got started in tgolf when he found a six-iron and hit tennis balls with it until he eventually took lessons...Before joining the SENIOR TOUR he had dreams of competing against the best, and is always trying to improve and stretch his horizon...Has held numerous jobs in his life, including waiter, forklift salesman, carpenter, job superintendent, concrete subcontractor foreman and construction contractor...Received a scholarship from the Houston Golf Association.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Champions was T2nd in 2000 at the Audi Senior Classic.
